meanings.definition: A person who gives names to things.
meanings.sent1: The nomenclators in the zoo named all the animals.
meanings.sent2: The nomenclators at the company were responsible for labeling the products.
meanings.sent3: The nomenclators had a naming contest for the new species of bird.
meanings.sent4: She was like a nomenclator, assigning titles to the characters in her stories.
meanings.sent5: The nomenclators were like wizards, conjuring names out of thin air.

meanings.definition: A list of names or terms.
meanings.sent1: The library had a nomenclators of all the books available for borrowing.
meanings.sent2: The nomenclators of students who made the honor roll was displayed in the school hallway.
meanings.sent3: The nomenclators for the upcoming event were filled with famous guests.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a nomenclators of memories, each name triggering a different recollection.
meanings.sent5: The nomenclators of flowers in the garden was a colorful display of variety.
